intro: Hieracium probolophorum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer, surrounded by a ring of bracts. It has hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in dry conditions. Hieracium probolophorum is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
